intro: Ceratophyllum demersum var. missionis, commonly known as the Mission watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to North America. It features whorled leaves that are typically 10–20 mm long and have a distinctive, serrated edge. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in freshwater environments with moderate to high light and nutrient levels. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in some regions, impacting aquatic ecosystems.
